arm_group.description: Active Cervel Neurotech Multi-Coil Transcranial Magnetic Stimulator
Inactive Cervel Neurotech Multi-Coil Transcranial Magnetic Stimulator

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether the Cervel Neurotech rTMS device is safe
      and effective in the treatment of depression in people who do not get better with
      antidepressant medications or cannot take antidepressant medications.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial for the Treatment of Depression With Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Current major depressive disorder (MDD)

          -  Resistance or intolerance to antidepressant medication in the current depressive
             episode, or intolerance to antidepressant medication in a past depressive episode

          -  On a stable psychotropic regimen prior to screening and be willing to maintain the
             current regimen and dosing for the duration of the study

          -  Weight less than 350 pounds

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current major depressive disorder episode of more than three years

          -  Seizure disorder

          -  History of brain injury, stroke or active central nervous system disease

          -  Cardiac pacemaker, implanted device (deep brain stimulation) or metal in the brain,
             cervical spinal cord, or upper thoracic spinal cord unless deemed MRI-safe

          -  Active suicidal intent or plan

          -  Other significant psychiatric disorder

          -  Alcohol or substance dependence or abuse

          -  Prior treatment with transcranial magnetic stimulation

          -  Have failed to clinically remit to an adequate trial of electroconvulsive therapy or
             vagus nerve stimulation

          -  If female, pregnant or lactating or planning to become pregnant within the next three
             months

intervention.description: The Cervel Neurotech multi-coil transcranial magnetic stimulator is an investigational repetitive transcranial stimulation (rTMS) device.  In the active group, magnetic power output will be delivered to the subject through the coils.
intervention.intervention_name: Active Cervel Neurotech Multi-Coil Transcranial Magnetic Stimulator

intervention.description: The Cervel Neurotech multi-coil transcranial magnetic stimulator is an investigational repetitive transcranial stimulation (rTMS) device.  In the inactive group, no magnetic power output will be delivered to the subject through the coils.
intervention.intervention_name: Inactive Cervel Neurotech Multi-Coil Transcranial Magnetic Stimulator

facility.name: Kaiser Permanente Center for Health Research

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Double-Blind, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Sham-Controlled Feasibility Trial of Multi-Coil Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS) for the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder

primary_outcome.description: Measured by the 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to four weeks (the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to eight weeks (four weeks after the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as greater than or equal to 50% decrease in the 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to four weeks (the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as greater than or equal to 50% decrease in the 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to eight weeks (four weeks after the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression score less than or equal to 10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to four weeks (the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as 24-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression score less than or equal to 10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to eight weeks (four weeks after the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to four weeks (the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to eight weeks (four weeks after the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events and serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to eight weeks (four weeks after the conclusion of rTMS treatment)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
